refnamediv.refpurpose: The function returns the string-value of the current node like XPATH function 'string()'.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The function returns the string-value of the current node. This is similar to the XPATH function 'string()'.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: The member function returns wide string.

example.title: A table with an XMLType column
example.para: This populates a table with XML data and then selects the string-value of an 'ename' element from the appropriate record.
example.screen:
create table TEST_XMLS (I integer primary key, XMLVAL XMLType); insert into TEST_XMLS values (1, XMLType('<emp><empno>221</empno><ename>John</ename></emp>')); insert into TEST_XMLS values (2, XMLType('<po><pono>331</pono><poname>PO_1</poname></po>')); insert into TEST_XMLS values (3, XMLType('<oil-rig xml:id="14a_06" water="0.413"/><oil-rig xml:id="14b_06" water="0.402"/>')); select e.XMLVAL.extract ('//ename').getStringVal() as ENAME from TEST_XMLS as e where e.XMLVAL.existsNode('/emp/empno') ENAME NVARCHAR _______________________________________________________________________________
John
1 Rows. -- 00000 msec.
